title: Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect
description:
When setting the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report displays the same results. The expected behavior is as follows: 

1. For Plain, I expect the literal content (including tags) to be displayed. 
2. For Auto, I expect the content 1, 2, and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. 
3. For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags. Please see the attached report for reference.
OB: The dynamic text element's Content Type property does not have any effect on how the report is displayed. The same results are shown regardless of whether the Content Type is set to Auto, Plain, or HTML.
EB:
The report should display the content differently depending on the chosen Content Type. 

1. For Plain, the report should show the literal content with all tags included. 
2. For Auto, the report should display content 1, 2, and 3 properly without any HTML or RTF tags. 
3. For HTML, the report should display content 1 and 2 without HTML tags and display content 3 literally with RTF tags.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Plain.
3. Observe the displayed content.
4. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto.
5. Observe the displayed content.
6. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to HTML.
7. Observe the displayed content.
